intro: Laburnum alschingeri, commonly known as the golden chain tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its long, drooping clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces elongated, woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its striking floral display and historical use in traditional medicine highlight its botanical and cultural significance.
